Just curious: Does this require a MOD'd Wii? or can i just burn and play?

SCORE! Works flawlessly, but for those of you asking about non-modded Wii's, no dice. I did a slow-burn after I converted to an ISO and the burn failed 5 minutes in...wasn't my equipment or user error, I've burned many, many backups using only Verbatim discs, this will only work on a mod. Makes a file about 3.5 gigs on your HDD. Thanks Smurf

Almost forgot, play in a dark room on the best TV in the house, the dark scenes are very dark (not an upload issue), all the audio is straight from the film, original actors, very cool cut-scenes.
Is there a PAL version somewhere?
Could someone post up an iso version

DIdnt work for me, when I converted wbfs file to iso ( with Wiijmanager), it created 2 iso files, and when I burn the first one, it wont install, it freezes..... do I need both Iso files?.......its happened a few times with Wii games so far

Here's how I did installed and played with success in Wii:

Convert to .iso with Wii Backup Manager
http://r3dux.org/2010/04/how-to-convert-wbfs-image-files-to-iso-images/

Then put the iso in my External hard Disk 320gb 
with wbfs manager.

Then in Wii used uLoader with IOS 223

It works!
going to seed for a long time

smurf212: WBFS manager does convert stuff to the wbfs format but for some reason, for me at least, it refuses to directly import files already in the wbfs format. I do the same thing that sammmmurai suggested. I use Wii backup manager to convert them to iso and then load them to external using WBFS Manager. To run the games i use the d2x cios from waninkoko in slot 249 and run the games from usbloader gx.
Felt I should add that I,m on firmware 4.3u and i hacked my Wii using the Letterbomb mod.

@axprodigy1, WBFS manager I'm not sure about as I haven't used it in a couple years, but I use Wii Backup Manager for everything, whether it be rar, iso, or wbfs files it takes care of it just fine.  Just make sure if you have any dual layer and are using FAT32 that you change the settings accordingly.
